intro: Chaetanthera lanata, commonly known as the hairy chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive hairy foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
